    • Method Detail

      • shuffle

        public int shuffle(ByteBuffer src,
                   int srcOff,
                   ByteBuffer dest,
                   int destOff,
                   int nElements,
                   int bytesPerElement,
                   int blockSize)
        Description copied from interface: BitShuffler
        Performs a bit-shuffle from src into dest. ByteBuffer positions remain unchanged.
        Specified by:
        shuffle in interface BitShuffler
        Parameters:
        src - The src ByteBuffer
        srcOff - The src offset (where bit shuffle should start)
        dest - The dest ByteBuffer
        destOff - The dest offset (where the shuffled bytes should be stored)
        nElements - The number of elements in src
        bytesPerElement - The bytes used to represent one element
        blockSize - The block size to use (recommended to use 0 for auto selection)
        Returns:
        int The processed bytes

      • unshuffle

        public int unshuffle(ByteBuffer src,
                     int srcOff,
                     ByteBuffer dest,
                     int destOff,
                     int nElements,
                     int bytesPerElement,
                     int blockSize)
        Description copied from interface: BitShuffler
        Performs a bit-unshuffle from src into dest. ByteBuffer positions remain unchanged.
        Specified by:
        unshuffle in interface BitShuffler
        Parameters:
        src - The src ByteBuffer
        srcOff - The src offset (where bit-unshuffle should start)
        dest - The dest ByteBuffer
        destOff - The dest offset (where the unshuffled bytes should be stored)
        nElements - The number of elements in src
        bytesPerElement - The bytes used to represent one element
        blockSize - The block size to use (recommended to use 0 for auto selection)
        Returns:
        int The processed bytes
